stem: Which modality is most operator‑dependent and useful for dynamic assessment of superficial tendons in the upper limb?
rationale_correct: Ultrasound is operator‑dependent and excels at dynamic, superficial soft‑tissue assessment (e.g., tendons).

rationale_distractors.A: Radiographs are static and primarily evaluate bone alignment/density.
rationale_distractors.B: CT is static and best for osseous detail.
rationale_distractors.C: MRI is excellent for soft tissue but not dynamic in real‑time.
rationale_distractors.E: PET‑CT evaluates metabolic activity and anatomy; not used for dynamic tendon assessment.

evidence.citation: Rhodes D. Learning objectives for Radiology of the Upper Limb. 2018/2021.
